pageContext.claim: “We had lost almost 200,000 manufacturing jobs under the previous administration.  And you all know, they say, 'Well, you have to lose manufacturing jobs.  It will get worse and worse.  Manufacturing jobs are obsolete.'  No, they’re not obsolete; they’re the greatest jobs we have.”
pageContext.analysis: Because of the Great Recession, more than 1.5 million manufacturing jobs were lost in the two years before Obama became president and there was a difficult return to the status quo under Obama -- which finally bore fruit as Trump took office. Obama never said manufacturing jobs were obsolete.
